page.title: 08MARITIME MUSEUM
page.content: {The Merseyside Maritime Museum}is located in the famous{South Docks}of the Port of Liverpool. It is adjacent to the{Canning, Salthouse and Albert {Docks.}The Albert Dock, incidentally, comprises the largest collection of Class 1 listed buildings, on one site, in Great Britain. The Museum is one aspect of the{extensive redevelopment of the South Docks, the Albert Dock Village and the Festival Gardens being two more. The Maritime Museum offers many fascinating{historical activities to the visitor including an illustrated quayside trail showing how capstans, winches etc. worked. Other attractions include{Sir Alec Rose's {yacht 'Lively Lady',}sailmaking, ropecraft, coopering and the restoration and rebuilding of various craft including a Morecambe Bay shrimper.
